summary: Energy enthusiast and passionate RE professional with a Bachelor degree in Electrical Engineering and a Masters degree from EIT KIC InnoEnergy Programme in Energy for Smart Cities at KTH,Royal Institute of Technology, Sweden and an Internship in companies like Siemens has helped me to grow my  critical problem solving and analytical skills with good team playing. I currently work as a Technical Support Engineer at Tritium Pty Ltd which is worlds one of the leading fast chargers manufacturer for Electrical Vehicles (EVs).

projects: [{'title': 'Impacts of Decentralized Energies Development on the Energy System', 'date': {'start': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'The conventional power system structure is characterized by a small number of companies which control the generation, transmission and distribution and follow the demand by changing production which makes the energy flow unidirectional. In a decentralize energy system, the production is unbundled from transmission and distribution and a larger number of entities, such as small companies and prosumers take part in these activities. This movement of horizontalization is directly connected to the decentralization and to some extent is also dependent on the implementation of information and communication technologies such as Smart Grid.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Shahinur', 'last_name': 'Islam', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Lead Diagonistics Engineer at Tritium'}]}, {'title': 'The Future Urban Landscape with Economic Justification for the Future Investments: Smart Energy, Transport, Materials and Communication for the city Achireale- Italy', 'date': {'start': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2015}}, 'description': 'Future European cities have the additional challenge of already being constructed, meaning that future sustainability must coexist with historical buildings and infrastructure. While these may be great challenges, they can be turned into great opportunities with new technologies, innovative business models and coordinated policies. The solutions should target optimal energy and resource efficiency, ideally through the integration of new technologies (energy, mobility, ICT), development of new business models, and new methodologies o urban governance. The explicit goal should be to create a smart district where marked improvements in energy sustainability and liveabilican be demonstrated an plausibly executed. Project proposals are expected to have a 20 year timeline; starting in 2015 and reaching the desired objectives by 2035. ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Shahinur', 'last_name': 'Islam', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Lead Diagonistics Engineer at Tritium'}]}, {'title': 'Design and Implementation of Water-depth Measurement and Object Detection Using Ultrasonic Signal System', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'Numbers of water transports are increasing rapidly throughout the world, failure or inaccuracies of the sensing equipment in this application resulting catastrophic consequences such as collision between ships, causing the increase of accidents in river or sea. The anchor, which is a traditional method, is used to measure water depth by most of the water transports in our country and they also do not use any scheme that can protect them from any shrinking river bergs. This project describes a design and implementation of effective water depth measurement and object detection alert system that can perform efficiently using ultrasonic signal.', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Shahinur', 'last_name': 'Islam', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Lead Diagonistics Engineer at Tritium'}]}]

As a Support Engineer at Tritium, I am responsible for all pre- and post-sale technical supports. The role includes but not limited to-

- Commissioning, troubleshooting and providing technical guidelines on DC fast chargers ranging from 50 kW- 350kW 
- Remote fault resolution or/and diagnosis using Linux command line tools
- OCPP protocol, integration, firmware and debugging code
- Systems testing, service instructions documentation, design reviews and customers feedback
- Reporting and assisting engineering to define software requirements and product developments', 'title': 'Technical Support Engineer', 'employment_type': 'Full-time'}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': 'MOBI, the Mobility, Logistics and Automotive Technology Research Centre', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Brussels Area, Belgium', 'date': {'start': {'month': 11, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2018}}, 'company': 'MOBI, the Mobility, Logistics and Automotive Technology Research Centre', 'description': 'During my work at MOBI in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Energy Technology (ETEC) at Vrije Universiteit Brussel, my research was focused on Co-design of wide-bandgap technology based power electronics converters for vehicle and stationary applications.', 'title': 'Research Associate', 'employment_type': None}]}, {'company': {'id': None, 'name': ' E.ON Energy Research Center- ACS Institute, RWTH Aachen University', 'logo': None, 'url': None, 'employees': {'start': None, 'end': None}}, 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'profile_positions': [{'location': 'Mathieustraße 10, 52074 Aachen', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2017}}, 'company': ' E.ON Energy Research Center- ACS Institute, RWTH Aachen University', 'description': 'Increasing amount of Renewable Energy Sources (RES) poses significant technical challenges in terms of stability and dynamic performance of Power System. The replacement of synchronous generators with RES shrinks system inertia, which in turn weakness system damping in case of disturbances. In such systems, any disturbance may cause high-frequency deviation and instability problems. Synchronverters and Virtual Synchronous Generator (VSG) control represent the fundamental solution to tackle these challenges. The primary objectives of this work to handle the following tasks: 

→Modeling of Synchronverter for RES and storage system

→Perform stability analysis considering different scenarios to test and validate the presented synchronverter and its control in transmission system', 'title': 'Intern', 'employment_type': None}]},
